description: Travel advice for New Year's Eve 2019

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["There are changes to transport on New Year's Eve, with many services running all night and free travel on TfL public transport from 23:45 on New Year's Eve until 04:30 on New Year's Day."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
This page covers travel for the whole of New Year's Eve and the early hours of New Year's Day. For travel after 04:30 on 1 January, see our New Year's Day page .
It includes changes to roads and public transport for the London New Year's Eve Fireworks.
You must have a ticket to attend the London New Year's Eve Fireworks. For more information visit www.london.gov.uk/nye
See our Status updates map for Tube, Overground, TfL Rail, DLR and London Trams services for 31 December.
{"template":"video","style":"9apiFRQjyVQ","title":"New Year's Eve travel","link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Road and bridge closures"}
From early afternoon, you will not be able to walk, drive or cycle through parts of central London as roads and bridges close for the London New Year's Eve Fireworks.

{"template":"table","rows":[["\u003cstrong\u003eBridge\u003c/strong\u003e ","\u003cstrong\u003eClosed from\u003c/strong\u003e "],["Westminster Bridge","14:00"],["Jubilee Footbridge (towards Embankment station)","14:00"],["Jubilee Footbridge (towards South Bank)","15:00"],["Waterloo Bridge","16:00 (pedestrians)19:00 (traffic)"],["Blackfriars Bridge","20:00 (traffic)Will close to pedestrians if necessary"],["Lambeth Bridge","20:00 (traffic)Will close to pedestrians if necessary"],["Southwark Bridge","Will close if necessary"],["Millennium Footbridge","20:00"],["Vauxhall Bridge (pavements only - bridge will remain open to vehicles)","Police to decide"]]}
If you need to cross the river in central London, use Tube and bus services, which run all night and are free to use from 23:45 until 04:30.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Travel changes"}
There are changes and planned works on the following services today. All our other services are running normally.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Buses"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["From 14:00 some bus routes in central London diverted or stop short of their destination because of road and bridge closures"," \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/bus/route/507/?direction=outbound\"\u003e507\u003c/a\u003e route - enhanced Saturday service"," \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/bus/route/521/?direction=outbound\"\u003e521\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/bus/route/68/?direction=outbound\"\u003eX68\u003c/a\u003e - special service"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Tube"}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Daytime and evening"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Reduced service on all lines","First trains at weekday times","First Central line trains between Hainault and Woodford via Grange Hill at Saturday times","No Piccadilly line service between Uxbridge and Rayners Lane","No District line service between Earl's Court and Kensington (Olympia)"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Special all-night service"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Free travel from 23:45 on New Year's Eve to 04:30 on New Year's Day","Waterloo \u0026 City line runs until around 02:40","No Piccadilly line service between Uxbridge and Rayners Lane","No District line service between Earl's Court and Kensington (Olympia)","Trains run all night on all other routes"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Tube station closures"}
Underground stations near the fireworks event and in busy areas will be exit-only or interchange-only at times to help manage crowds safely. Stations will re-open when it is safe to do so.
Camden Town and Waterloo will use a queuing system.

{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Cycling"}

{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Closed docking stations"}

Belvedere Road 1 & 2, Bouverie Street, Colombo Street, Concert Hall Approach 1 & 2, Craven Street, Embankment (Savoy), Jubilee Gardens, Lambeth Palace Road, Lower Marsh, Milroy Walk, Northumberland Avenue, Somerset House, Southwark Station 1 & 2, Stamford Street, Storey's Gate, Strand, Tallis Street, Waterloo Bridge, Waterloo Road, Waterloo Station 1, 2 & 3 and Whitehall Place.
Docking stations will be reopened from around 18:00 on Thursday 2 January.
Check availability using the online docking station map .
